instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW: What is PM_BATLOW? PM_BATLOW is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power Button Not Working
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, history is weird, however came to me with dent in charger port, and it looks like some charger port water damage too. Owner said she brought it to apple and they diagnosed it as a bad logic board. Board will boot in safe mode on its own sometimes, and fans will spin to max.

When I first got the board, the magsafe light was not present. Replaced DC-In board and cable, now we have light showing however power button does not work.

I thought it was keyboard/trackpad related, however I can confirm it isnt. Shorting <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> does nothing, no reaction. Manual rst works. Strange thing is also when booted into macOS, and when the display lid is closed, display will turn off and go to sleep, however when opening again it will not trigger any reaction to <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL>, will check when and if <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is present or not.

Any clues or other needed info?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power Button Not Working
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> has steady 3V, until pressing power button?
Check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, when trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.
Also test the reaction without LIO flex connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power Button Not Working
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> is a constant 3.42V, even when pressing power button.
No pulse on <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW</SIGNAL> when triggering <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> by power button and tweezers manually.
No change in reaction with LIO connected or disconnected.

Reflow smc?

EDIT: fans run high and macos boots into safe mode sometimes, checked hw monitor and heatppe incoming air sensors are both reading 128c. No corrosion on <TRANSISTOR>Q5830</TRANSISTOR> or <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>, smc issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power Button Not Working
threads.message:
Does it always boot in SMC bypass mode?
For temp sensors issue, try disconnecting webcam.
If still the same, try known good LIO flex/board and trackpad flex/board.

"<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> is a constant 3.42V, even when pressing power button."
Bad keyboard, or trackpad flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power Button Not Working
threads.message:
You are right, misdiagnosed onoff reaction, as it reacts to it as the power button, hold for more than 5-6 seconds to have effect.

thank you once again

Also it does not always boot into bypass mode, just sometimes, especially when I leave it in macOS running for some time.

Looking into <CHIP>U5800</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q5830</TRANSISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power Button Not Working
threads.message: Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5830</TRANSISTOR> and fully working and correct temperatures. Happy Macbook.
